DOCNAME: CASE OF FC MRETEBI v. GEORGIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Remainder inadmissible;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant club was founded on DATE in GPE . Subsequent to the last changes in its corporate structure , on DATE , the ORG in GPE incorporated the applicant as a branch of a NORP limited liability company , “ BAUML GmbH ” .
CARDINAL . Under contracts of CARDINAL May and DATE , the applicant engaged Mr PERSON ( “ the footballer ” ) as a professional player until DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant and the football club ORG , both members of ORG ( “ the GFF ” ) , entered into an agreement on the footballer 's transfer to ORG . It was arranged that the footballer would play for the new club after the latter had paid the applicant MONEY ( the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) , according to the applicant ) . In addition , if the footballer was later transferred abroad , the applicant was to receive PERCENT of the international transfer fee owed to ORG . If ORG failed to fulfil that obligation , the agreement between it and the footballer would become null and void .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG paid the applicant the sum agreed in roubles and the domestic transfer took effect .

CARDINAL . Under a contract of CARDINAL DATE , ORG transferred the footballer to ORG for a lump sum of ORG CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) . In the event of the footballer 's further transfer by the NORP club for a fee in excess of USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) , ORG was entitled to receive PERCENT of the excess amount . Subsequently , ORG indeed transferred the footballer to ORG ORG , and ORG thus received around GBP CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) from the NORP club .

CARDINAL . Having received the lump - sum transfer fee from GPE City ORG , ORG never remitted to the applicant the percentage agreed under the contract of CARDINAL DATE . Seeking to obtain the amount owed to it , the applicant complained to the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of the GFF decided that ORG owed the applicant USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) , corresponding to CARDINAL of the transfer fee paid by ORG . ORG was ordered to pay this sum in CARDINAL instalments .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant referred the matter to ORG ( the “ ORG ” ) requesting its intervention to secure enforcement by the GFF of its decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . The ORG reminded the GFF on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE of its obligation to enforce decisions and thus to settle the dispute between the NORP clubs , warning that non - compliance with ORG directives might result in disciplinary proceedings against the ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided that ORG was liable to pay the total amount of ORG CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) to the applicant immediately and that , in case of failure to comply with this decision , ORG would be relegated to ORG . That sanction would not , however , release the debtor from its obligation to fulfil its financial commitments visà - vis the applicant . In addition , the ORG warned both clubs that they were barred , under the PERSON and ORG , from referring the dispute to a court of law .

CARDINAL . Following the applicant 's complaints , on DATE and DATE , that the dispute had still not been settled , the ORG again notified the ORG , requesting the enforcement of the latter 's decisions at the latest by CARDINAL DATE , on pain of international sanctions .

CARDINAL . In the meantime ORG had taken the matter to a civil court . In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , the GPE - Saburtalo ORG in GPE declared the transfer agreement signed by both parties on DATE to be null and void . Subsequently , the decision of ORG of the GFF of DATE was also annulled . During the hearing , the applicant pointed out that ORG had no right to examine the issue , since the clubs , as ORG members , enjoyed immunity from the jurisdiction of the ordinary courts . That argument was left unanswered . The judgment , not having been appealed , became binding .
CARDINAL . On DATE , in view of that judgment , the GFF decided to annul its decision of DATE and thus to terminate the dispute .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG ( “ the Bureau ” ) , a disputes resolution organ . In a decision of DATE , the ORG considered that the ORG should intervene since it was clear that CARDINAL of the parties “ was not behaving properly and that the PERSON was not able to settle the matter by itself ” .

CARDINAL . Without challenging the findings of the Vake - Saburtalo ORG in GPE on DATE about the nullity of the contract of CARDINAL DATE , the ORG stated on DATE that the footballer 's transfer from the applicant to ORG had nevertheless taken place and that no compensation had been paid in return . It therefore concluded that :

“ There had been a transfer of possession of the federative rights to the player between CARDINAL clubs , without any contract binding them ( since the transfer contract had been declared null and void by the court ) and , since CARDINAL of the parties had indeed performed its obligation , it was logical for that party to be properly indemnified for having done so in good faith . ”

CARDINAL . In the light of its findings , the ORG decided that compensation for the training and development of the footballer had to be paid to the applicant ; both clubs were instructed to negotiate the amount . In the event of further disagreement , ORG would resolve the issue for them . Furthermore , noting that ORG had severely breached LAW of LAW by submitting the dispute to a court of law , the ORG fined that club CHF CARDINAL ( ORG MONEY ) .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant lodged an appeal against this decision with ORG ( “ the Executive Committee ” ) , which delivered its final decision on DATE . The appeal having been lodged out of time , ORG rejected it . However , in view of the fact that the clubs had failed to negotiate an amount of compensation , it determined that ORG had to pay the applicant USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Dinamo ORG complied with this decision and fully paid the debt in DATE .

CARDINAL . Considering that the amount fixed by the ORG was insufficient to compensate for the loss sustained , the applicant brought an action for damages in the amounts of ORG and GBP CARDINAL ( totalling EUR CARDINAL ) against the GFF before a court of law . It argued that the respondent , contrary to its LAW , had failed to abide by its positive obligation to protect the rights of its member clubs . As a result of this negligence , the unjust enrichment of ORG had occurred at the expense of the applicant 's property rights .

CARDINAL . NORP The applicant also requested leave to defer payment of the court fees ( known as ORG fees ) until after examination of the case . On DATE the ORG refused to defer payment on the ground that the applicant 's request was not substantiated by evidence of insolvency . The value of its claim being high , the applicant eventually paid the court fees , in the maximum amount of GEL CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) under LAW CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure ( “ the ORG ” ) , on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The Tbilisi Regional Court , as the court of first instance , examined the action on DATE and dismissed it as manifestly ill - founded .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a cassation appeal with ORG of GPE . Referring to the fact that it had suspended its activities because of financial problems ( near bankruptcy ) caused by the respondent 's wrongful acts , the applicant requested exemption from the court fees for cassation proceedings . In case this motion for total exemption was rejected , the applicant also requested leave to pay the court fees either in a reduced amount or with deferment . It referred to the right of access to a court guaranteed by LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to grant the applicant 's request for partial or full exemption from the court fees . Without referring to any specific circumstances , it bluntly stated that no ground for exemption , under Articles DATE of the ORG , existed in the case at hand . The court invited the applicant to pay the GEL CARDINAL,CARDINAL fee within DATE . When it failed to do so , ORG , in a final decision of DATE , declared the cassation claim inadmissible . This decision , adopted under the written procedure , was communicated to the applicant on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , its inability to receive from ORG proper indemnification in return for the footballer 's transfer , as well as the high costs which it had incurred in the domestic and international proceedings against ORG and the ORG , constituted the main reasons for its financial collapse . The auditor 's report of DATE confirmed the applicant 's insolvency and the resulting cessation of its activities in the sphere of football . The report stated that , due to the inability to pay the participation fee , the applicant had been excluded from the national football championship since DATE . Among other outstanding debts , the report noted arrears of interest on a loan which the applicant had obtained in order to pay the court fee of GEL CARDINAL for the proceedings before ORG ( paragraph CARDINAL above ) .

Pursuant to LAW , the claimant and respondent are each expected to prove the circumstances on which they base their arguments in the adversarial proceedings .
